p: Larvae of An. stephensi are found in a wide variety of breeding habitats such as fresh and brackish waters in rural, coastal and urban areas. In rural areas, the larvae exploit freshwater pools, stream banks and bottoms, catch basins, seepage canals, wells, and local water storage containers. In urban areas, they readily breed in numerous artificial containers inside and outside homes, as well as in industrial regions [ 9, 13, 14].
